TopicTitle: How long should I make my away time from KSP?

Articles.Content:
Before we start, I am a massive KSP fan, I have pretty much played nonstop for six months, but I need to take a Hiatus, play some other games, and come back with my desire to build rockets rekindled.

How long should I spend away from the game?
Just stop. Once you get the urge to do something fire it up again.
I've been doing other stuff... working on some Arduino stuff and making flight simulator instruments... but ironically it's still to do with KSP.
other games? real world.... they've long since faded since I found KSP
I know that feeling, slowly coming back after 4 months... just wait till you get the itch to blow up more stuff
Think I have an extended break from KSP starting in about 30 minutes when my war thunder 1.31 patch finishes downloading.

Just wait until the next major update comes out, like if they add resources or career mode. I had a break from the game for a bit back in 0.15 and came back for again for 0.16, and then stopped again. I only really began playing again until 0.17 when the planets first came out.

Edited June 11, 2013 by rryy

I've been doing other stuff... working on some Arduino stuff and making flight simulator instruments... but ironically it's still to do with KSP.

What are you building and how's that coming?

I've considered this myself.
With the beginnings of Career Mode in the works for 0.21, I would suggest coming back for that.
Fly to Duna in real time. Set up your transfer burn and then just leave it. When you get there you can play again.
I too have stopped for a while, want to get back into it when I have some free time. Just do other things, don't set a break peroid or anything like that. Just live your life
Come back as soon as you feel like coming back. You're the only one who'll know when it's time.
